original: Bondeson, Carl August Ragnar, tullförvaltare, Halmstad, f. 20/7/84 i Vessiige, Haiti, k, av polischefen P. M. Carlsson o. Jenny Bondeson. G. 16 m. Elsa Sundimark. Barn: Arne f. 18, Britt 22. — Stud:ex. 05. E. o. kamm:-skriv. i Halmstad 05, bitr. dito i Upps. 09, kamm: skriv, i Gbg 12, för flytt. t. Sthlm 14, andre byråassist. i general-tullstyr. 20, tullkontr. i Sthlm 24, förflytt. t. Gävle 25, förste tullkontr. i Kalmar 32, tullöverkontr. i Gävle 33, tullförvalt. i Halmstad sed. 45. Tax:-ndsordf. i Gävle 43-45. RVO 47.
translated: Bondeson, Carl August Ragnar, Customs Officer, Halmstad, born July 20th, 1884 in Vessiige, Haiti, son of the police chief P. M. Carlsson and Jenny Bondeson. Married to Elsa Sundimark since 1916. They have two children: Arne (born 1918) and Britt (born 1922). He graduated from high school in 1905. He became a trainee and clerk in the Kammarkollegiet (Swedish National Financial Management Authority) in Halmstad in 1905, and later worked as an assistant clerk in Uppsala in 1909, clerk in Gothenburg in 1912, moved to Stockholm in 1914, assistant bureau assistant in the General Customs Board in 1920, customs inspector in Stockholm in 1924, moved to Gävle in 1925, first customs inspector in Kalmar in 1932, customs superintendent in Gävle in 1933, and customs manager in Halmstad since 1945. He was chairman of the Tax Delegation in Gävle from 1943 to 1945 and was awarded the Royal Order of Vasa in 1947.
